item.title:
RT by @emilianobonassi: üîàAnnounce üöÄZK Security FrameworküöÄ
ZKPs are revolutionizing privacy and security, but they also introduce new attack surfaces. To address these challenges, @salus_sec & @zerobasezk have launched the ZK Security Framework‚Äîa structured approach to analyzing ZKP vulnerabilities, providing security audit checklists, and offering mitigation strategies to help developers build more secure ZK systems.
üîç Key Security Risks ‚úÖ Completeness Issues: Over-constrained circuits may cause verification failures ‚úÖ Soundness Issues: Under-constrained circuits can allow attackers to forge proofs ‚úÖ Information Leakage: Trusted setup leaks may lead to stolen assets ‚úÖ Arithmetic Overflows: Improper field arithmetic can be exploited
üìä ZK Risk Classification üî¥ High Risk: Proof forgery (e.g., Frozen Heart attack) üü° Medium Risk: Unintended exposure of private inputs üîµ Low Risk: Interfaces that are prone to misuse ‚ö´ Informational: Redundant constraints in logical
Operations More than just an audit checklist, the ZK Security Framework serves as an essential learning resource for developers and security researchers. A huge thank you to the @ethereum & @EF_ESP team for their invaluable support! üôåWithout you, we wouldn't be able to complete it !
Explore now üëâ GitHub: https://github.com/Salusec/zksecurity-framework/
item.dc:creator: @mirrorzk
item.description:
üîàAnnounce üöÄZK Security FrameworküöÄ

ZKPs are revolutionizing privacy and security, but they also introduce new attack surfaces. To address these challenges, @salus_sec & @zerobasezk have launched the ZK Security Framework‚Äîa structured approach to analyzing ZKP vulnerabilities, providing security audit checklists, and offering mitigation strategies to help developers build more secure ZK systems.

üîç Key Security Risks
‚úÖ Completeness Issues: Over-constrained circuits may cause verification failures
‚úÖ Soundness Issues: Under-constrained circuits can allow attackers to forge proofs
‚úÖ Information Leakage: Trusted setup leaks may lead to stolen assets
‚úÖ Arithmetic Overflows: Improper field arithmetic can be exploited

üìä ZK Risk Classification
üî¥ High Risk: Proof forgery (e.g., Frozen Heart attack) üü° Medium Risk: Unintended exposure of private inputs
üîµ Low Risk: Interfaces that are prone to misuse
‚ö´ Informational: Redundant constraints in logical

Operations
More than just an audit checklist, the ZK Security Framework serves as an essential learning resource for developers and security researchers.
A huge thank you to the @ethereum & @EF_ESP team for their invaluable support! üôåWithout you, we wouldn't be able to complete it !

Explore now üëâ GitHub: github.com/Salusec/zksecurit‚Ä¶

If you want a quick summary, here's the TL;DR üßµüëá

item.title:
RT by @emilianobonassi: Introducing zkFOCIL, a protocol for private Ethereum inclusion lists! Based on FOCIL (EIP-7805) and powered by Linkable Ring Signatures, validators publish inclusion lists privately without revealing their identity.
by @asn_d6, Benedikt and @soispoke
https://ethresear.ch/t/zkfocil-inclusion-list-privacy-using-linkable-ring-signatures/21688/1
item.dc:creator: @asn_d6
item.description:
Introducing zkFOCIL, a protocol for private Ethereum inclusion lists! Based on FOCIL (EIP-7805) and powered by Linkable Ring Signatures, validators publish inclusion lists privately without revealing their identity.

by @asn_d6, Benedikt and @soispoke

item.title:
RT by @emilianobonassi: Pectra is going live ü•≥
Holesky will fork at slot 3710976 (Mon, Feb 24 at 21:55:12 UTC) Sepolia will fork at slot 7118848 (Wed, Mar 5 at 07:29:36 UTC)
Assuming Sepolia goes smoothly, we'll pick the mainnet slot on the March 6 ACD call üìÖ
item.dc:creator: @TimBeiko
item.description:
Pectra is going live ü•≥

Holesky will fork at slot 3710976 (Mon, Feb 24 at 21:55:12 UTC)
Sepolia will fork at slot 7118848 (Wed, Mar 5 at 07:29:36 UTC)

Assuming Sepolia goes smoothly, we'll pick the mainnet slot on the March 6 ACD call üìÖ

item.title:
RT by @emilianobonassi: How Things Work #0: ZODA and the Accidental Computer
Today, we explore how Data Availability Sampling (DAS) can scale blockchains with @alexhevans and @GuilleAngeris from @BainCapCrypto.
Turns out, you can (somehow) embed verifiable computations over data in DA into DA ü™Ñ.
item.dc:creator: @commonwarexyz
item.description:

Turns out, you can (somehow) embed verifiable computations over data in DA into DA ü™Ñ.
